unnormalised: Income Tax Dept. extends ITR filing deadline 'cause, well, *life* happens!
normalised: income tax department extends I-T-R filing deadline 'cause, well, life happens!

unnormalised: The last date to file your Income Tax Return (ITR) has been extended to 31/08/2024! Yes, you read that right. Apparently, the department empathized with our collective procrastination – or maybe their servers crashed again (just kidding...mostly). But seriously, if you haven't filed yet, consider this your *final* warning... or maybe the *penultimate* one, knowing our track record. Remember, late fees can be a real drag, starting at ₹5000!
normalised: the last date to file your income tax return (I-T-R) has been extended to thirty first august two thousand and twenty four! yes, you read that right. apparently, the department empathized with our collective procrastination – or maybe their servers crashed again (just kidding...mostly). but seriously, if you haven't filed yet, consider this your final warning... or maybe the penultimate one, knowing our track record. remember, late fees can be a real drag, starting at rupee five thousand!

unnormalised: Sources say, 'technical difficulties' are to blame. Or maybe it was the sudden surge in filings around 11:59 PM on 31/07/2024, when everyone remembered they had taxes to pay! Whatever the reason, take advantage of this extra time. Get those Form 16s and receipts organized. Ask your CA for help (they're used to panicked calls by now). And for heaven's sake, don't wait until the very last minute *again*!
normalised: sources say, 'technical difficulties' are to blame. or maybe it was the sudden surge in filings around eleven fifty nine P-M on thirty first july two thousand and twenty four, when everyone remembered they had taxes to pay! whatever the reason, take advantage of this extra time. get those form sixteen S and receipts organized. ask your C-A for help (they're used to panicked calls by now). and for heaven's sake, don't wait until the very last minute again!

unnormalised: So, there you have it. Another extension, another chance to avoid the taxman's wrath. Now go forth and file... before they change their minds! And remember, paying taxes is not just a civic duty; it's your contribution to the nation...and maybe keeps the IT Dept from having to use those servers from the early 2000s. Don't forget to check your 26AS form too. It's not just a random number, it's your tax story!
normalised: so, there you have it. another extension, another chance to avoid the taxman's wrath. now go forth and file... before they change their minds! and remember, paying taxes is not just a civic duty; it's your contribution to the nation...and maybe keeps the I-T department from having to use those servers from the early two thousands. don't forget to check your twenty six A-S form too. it's not just a random number, it's your tax story!
